name: Twofish
description: Twofish is a symmetric block cipher designed by Bruce Schneier and others. It was one of the five finalist algorithms in the AES competition. Twofish is considered secure and is available under a royalty-free license.

securityNotes.message: Twofish was a finalist in the AES competition and is considered cryptographically secure
Twofish is royalty-free and unpatented, making it freely available for use
No significant cryptanalytic attacks against Twofish have been published

references.title: Twofish: A 128-Bit Block Cipher - Bruce Schneier

specifications.designer: Bruce Schneier, John Kelsey, Doug Whiting, David Wagner, Chris Hall, Niels Ferguson

technicalDetails.algorithm: Feistel network with 16 rounds and key-dependent S-boxes
technicalDetails.mds: Maximum Distance Separable (MDS) matrix for diffusion

useCases: Systems where patent-free algorithms are required
Applications requiring strong encryption with flexible key sizes
limitations: Slower than AES on most modern processors
Limited hardware acceleration support compared to AES
advantages: Strong security with no known practical attacks
